result.execSummary:
The defendant Sammy A Borrero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Defendnat to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

No illegal controlled substances.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
Complete a parenting class geared toward teenage children.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending a review on 6-27-14.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sammy A Borrero

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sammy A Borrero in court with attorney John S Joyce.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
*
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 6/27/14.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Complete a parenting class geared towards teenage children.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No illegal controlled substances.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Sammy A Borrero in court with attorney John S. Joyce.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNT 1:  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sammy A Borrero in court with attorney John S Joyce.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sammy A Borrero in court with attorney John S Joyce.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 01-14-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.B.   AND/OR  her residence  AND/OR  her place of school

Defendant Sammy A Borrero in court with attorney Lisa Marie Schlieben.  Defendant Sammy A Borrero in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, Court orders criminal complaint AMENDED as follows:  Page 1, Last paragraph, "According to J.B., ... location, J.(REMOVE: H, ADD: B) ...page."

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
Defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation.

As to Count 2:
Defendant entered a plea of Not Guilty.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
